title: Gary Gensler Says SEC Believes Ethereum Is Not a Security—At MIT in 2018 - Decrypt
summary: Gary Gensler, current SEC chair, previously taught a course at MIT where he stated that Ethereum is not a security. In 2018, he said that Ethereum is sufficiently decentralized that the SEC will consider it not a security. However, in his current role, he has refused to give a clear answer on whether Ethereum is a security or commodity. Gensler has also faced criticism for the SEC's intense crackdown on the crypto industry, with some lawmakers accusing him of stifling regulation and forcing American tech companies overseas.

title: A Guide to Ethereum Exploits and Security Best Practices - Ledger
summary:
Title: A Guide to Ethereum Exploits and Security Best Practices - Ledger.

Content: A Guide to Ethereum Exploits and Security Best Practices.

By Boring Security.

Read 7 minutes. Beginner.

Summary: This article provides a comprehensive guide to Ethereum security and best practices for avoiding common scams and exploits. It covers various methods of attack, including self-custody, setApprovalForAll, fake trading sites, gasless signatures, Seaport signatures, ETH_SIGN, address poisoning, private key compromise, and social engineering scams. The article emphasizes the importance of understanding the potential risks associated with these attacks and provides tips on how to safeguard your assets, such as vaulting your most valuable NFTs, using hardware wallets, and exercising caution when signing transactions.

Keywords: Ethereum, security, best practices, scams, exploits, self-custody, setApprovalForAll, gasless signatures, Seaport signatures, ETH_SIGN, address poisoning, private key comprom

title: Better Buy: Ethereum or Bitcoin? - The Motley Fool
summary:
In a recent article, The Motley Fool compares and contrasts the performance of Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH) in the cryptocurrency market. Despite Bitcoin's recent gains, the article argues that Ethereum may be the better investment choice due to its increasing diversification and technological advancements.

The article highlights two key indicators that suggest Ethereum is outperforming Bitcoin:

1. Correlation between Bitcoin and Ethereum: Coinbase Global's recent report showed that the correlation between Bitcoin and Ethereum has been declining, which could indicate that Ethereum is separating from Bitcoin and going its own way.
2. Ethereum/Bitcoin currency pair: The current value of the Ethereum/Bitcoin currency pair is around 0.066, which is higher than the historical range of 0.02 to 0.03. This suggests that Ethereum is gaining value relative to Bitcoin.

The article concludes that Ethereum may be a better investment choice due to its more divers

title: Gary Gensler Says SEC Believes Ethereum Is Not a Security—At MIT in 2018 - Yahoo Finance
summary: Gary Gensler, current SEC chair, previously taught a course at MIT where he stated that Ethereum is not a security. In 2018, he said that Ethereum is sufficiently decentralized to not be considered a security. However, in his current role, he has refused to give a clear answer on whether Ethereum is a security or not. Gensler has also stated that most of the crypto market is made up of non-securities, which contradicts his previous statement. The SEC has been cracking down on the crypto industry, and some political leaders have criticized Gensler for stifling regulation.

title: How to Reduce Ethereum Gas Fees? - LCX
summary: To reduce Ethereum gas fees, users can utilize simulation via DeFi Saver, optimize transaction timing, sort transaction types, and utilize DApps offering rewards and reduced gas fees. Additionally, gas tokens can be used to receive reimbursements in the form of ETH, and reduced gas fees can benefit users by making the platform more accessible and user-friendly. By following these guidelines, users can save on gas fees and ensure that their transactions are processed quickly and easily.

title: Ethereum Shanghai Upgrade Explained, Key Metrics to Track and Future Predictions - Nansen
summary: The Ethereum Shanghai upgrade has been activated, enabling the withdrawal of staked ETH. Key metrics to track include ETH deposits vs withdrawals, validators in the exit queue, and who is withdrawing ETH. The upgrade has potential long-term implications such as an increase in the amount of ETH staked, increased innovation and competition among staking services, and increased utilization of liquid staking tokens in DeFi. The upgrade is expected to usher in a new era for staked ETH and increase staking participation among ETH holders.

title: Solana has outperformed Bitcoin and Ethereum since January thanks in part to Mad Lads NFTs - Fortune
summary: Solana (SOL) has outperformed Bitcoin and Ethereum since January, with a 133% increase in value since $10 on Jan 1. Solana's market cap has recovered 72% after a decline following FTX's bankruptcy. The number of successful transactions on the Solana blockchain has risen to 713 million in March, the most since October. A new NFT collection, Mad Lads, has generated $17 million in sales over the past week, making it the most traded NFT, and helping Solana stay above Polygon in transactions. Solana's more flexible NFT technology is seen as a boon for entrepreneurs and creators.

title: Google Cloud Partners With Polygon (MATIC) To Help Developers Build on the Ethereum Scaling Solution - The Daily Hodl
summary: Google Cloud is partnering with Polygon (MATIC) to make it easier for developers to build and grow Web3 products on the Polygon ecosystem. Google Cloud will provide fully managed node hosting service Blockchain Node Engine, allowing developers to focus on building without configuring or running their own nodes. This partnership aims to accelerate the adoption of Polygon protocols, including Polygon PoS, Supernets, and zkEVM, and diversify cloud services across the Polygon network. The partnership is expected to onboard more people into Web3 and transform the blockchain landscape.

title: What Is Core? [Sponsored] - The Defiant - DeFi News
summary:
Core is a next-generation Web3 wallet that offers a holistic approach to managing assets across different blockchain networks. It provides a seamless experience for users to access DeFi protocols, NFTs, and educational content, all in one place. Core's three-pronged approach includes a web-based interface, a Chrome extension, and a mobile app, allowing users to access their assets and participate in DeFi from any device.

The wallet supports a wide range of assets, including Bitcoin, Ethereum, and EVM chain assets, and offers native bridging capabilities between different blockchain networks. This includes the Avalanche Bridge, which enables seamless asset transfers between Ethereum and Bitcoin networks, with low costs and enhanced liquidity.

Core also supports Avalanche Subnets, application-specific blockchains that live in parallel to the Avalanche C-Chain. This provides users with easy access to DeFi protocols and increases adoption of Avalanche Subnets.

The wallet is designed to be user-friendly and accessible, with a focus on bridging the gap between Web2 and Web3

title: Render (RNDR) Continues Hotstreak as Preparations Begin for Transition from Ethereum to Solana - Securities.io
summary: Render (RNDR) continues to experience a hot streak as preparations begin for its transition from Ethereum to Solana. The project has been gaining attention due to its ability to provide processing power when not in use, offering a means of passive income through the RNDR token. The community has agreed to transition to Solana to scale the network and prepare for future demand. The proposal, known as 'RNP-002', received an overwhelming majority vote in favor. As a result, RNDR has seen significant gains, up 6% on the day and 40% on the week, with the majority of trading volume occurring on Binance and Hotcoin Global. While Golem was a earlier project offering distributed computation, Render has emerged as the front runner, rising to 59th largest project by marketcap.

title: Why the Bitcoin Halving is Bullish for Every Single Cryptocurrency - CCN.com
summary: The article discusses the impact of the upcoming Bitcoin halving on the cryptocurrency market. The halving, which occurs every four years, reduces the reward given to miners for validating transactions on the Bitcoin blockchain, leading to a decrease in the inflation rate of the asset. The article argues that this event has historically led to a significant increase in the price of Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies, as reduced inflation increases demand pressure. The article cites data showing that the price of Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies have risen significantly following previous halvings. Additionally, the article suggests that media coverage and investor attention also play a role in driving the growth of cryptocurrencies, as increased attention leads to more people buying into the market. The article concludes that the bitcoin halving is a positive event for the cryptocurrency market as a whole.

title: PayPal Announces New Venmo Crypto Transfer Feature Starting May 2023 - Ethereum World News
summary: PayPal is expanding its Venmo platform to allow for crypto transfers to other users, on-chain wallets, and hardware wallets starting in May 2023. The feature was first introduced on PayPal last year and will now be available to Venmo's 60 million users in America. Users will be able to send cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, Litecoin, and Bitcoin Cash to family and friends on the platform and other wallets. PayPal has also noted that external transfers will be subject to network fees. This move comes as the crypto industry is being strictly regulated in the US, with PayPal halting its stablecoin plans.

title: Phantom To Launch Ethereum and Polygon Multichain Integration - CryptoDaily
summary: Phantom, a Solana-based crypto wallet, is expanding to support Ethereum and Polygon blockchains, allowing users to manage multiple chains and assets in a single platform. The feature will launch on May 1st and will enable users to import and use existing multichain addresses from popular wallets like MetaMask, Coinbase Wallet, and Rainbow. Phantom's multichain support follows a successful funding round in January 2022 and will enable users to interact with decentralized applications and NFT marketplaces across different blockchains. The wallet is also implementing new security features to mitigate phishing risks. With over 3 million users, Phantom is one of the few multichain crypto wallets in the market, and its expansion is expected to contribute to the growth of the crypto ecosystem.

title: Crypto Market Struggling as Bitcoin and Ethereum Shed Value - Fortunly News
summary: Crypto market plummets as Bitcoin and Ethereum prices drop sharply. Bitcoin down 15% in 24 hours, Ethereum down 14%. Market cap falls 8.5% to $1.84 trillion. Decline linked to stock market downturn, inflation concerns, and COVID-19 lockdowns. Price volatility common in crypto market.

title: Ethereum Price Prediction Daily (28-April): Urgent! This Could Be The Final Move For The ETH Head and Shoulders ... - Bitcoinsensus
summary: Ethereum is forming a potential Head and Shoulders Pattern in the 4-hour timeframe, which could lead to a -15% dump in value. Key levels to watch include $1,668, which is both the neckline support and the current price level. A breakdown below this level could confirm the bearish prediction.

title: Ethereum Growth: Check Out The Top 7 Upcoming L2s - Blockzeit
summary:
Ethereum is expanding its ecosystem with the development of layer 2 (L2) networks, which offer faster and cheaper transactions than the mainnet. Here are the top 7 L2s to watch out for:

1. Base: An optimistic-style L2 roll-up built on the Optimism OP Stack, with plans for main net release later this year.
2. Fuel: An L2 by Fuel Labs that aims to be the fastest execution layer for the modular blockchain stack, with a flexible and adaptable framework for developing blockchain networks.
3. Linea: ConsenSys' public test net of its zkEVM, now renamed 'Linea', which aims to power a new generation of decentralized apps built on Ethereum and will be natively integrated with popular DeFi infrastructure.
4. Scroll: A zkEVM that consists of 3 main infra components, with a test net currently in development and airdrops available on the Goerli Testnet.
5. Taiko: Another in-development zkEVM that aims to support all EVM opcodes in its L

title: Why is Ethereum Account Abstraction Important? - Cryptopolitan
summary: Ethereum account abstraction separates smart contract execution from user balances, enhancing security and efficiency. Two methods, EIP-4337 and EIP-2938, achieve this. EIP-4337 has been implemented and deployed to the mainnet on March 1, 2023, without altering the Ethereum protocol.
